# Schedule {#schedule}

The workshop is structured as a series of participatory live-coding
sessions (instructor and learner coding together) interspersed with
hands-on exercises, all with using a real-world, open dataset. There are
few lectures, only given at the start and end of the workshop. The
general schedule outline is shown in the below table.

```{r schedule-table, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval=TRUE}
options(knitr.kable.NA = "")
library(dplyr)
library(gt)
add_link <- function(text, icon, link) {
    added_link <- paste0("<a href=\"", link, "\"><i class='fa-solid fa-", icon, "' style='color:#cb4335'></i>", text, "</a>")
    if (link == "")
        added_link <- paste0("<i class='fa-solid fa-", icon, "' style='color:#cb4335'></i>", text)
    return(html(added_link))
}

schedule <- readr::read_csv(here::here("includes/schedule.csv"),
                            col_types = "ccccc") %>%
    mutate(across(everything(), ~ if_else(is.na(.x), "", .x))) %>%
    mutate(`Session topic` = purrr::pmap(
        list(`Session topic`, icon, link), 
        ~add_link(..1, ..2, ..3)
        )) %>%
    select(-icon, -link) 

schedule %>%
    gt(groupname_col = "Day",
       caption = "General schedule for the 3 days of the course.") %>%
    tab_style(style = list(cell_text(weight = "bold")),
              locations = cells_row_groups()) %>%
    tab_style(style = list(cell_text(weight = "bold")),
              locations = cells_column_labels()) %>% 
    cols_align(align = "left", columns = everything()) %>%
    opt_table_lines("none") %>% 
    opt_table_outline("none") %>% 
    opt_table_lines("none") %>% 
    opt_row_striping()
```
